Subject: Version 3.8K information


Just a brief note -- we've released Gladiator version 3.8K, which fixes a few
bugs and (finally) adds two special abilities to the Barbarian class.  If
you're interested in grabbing it, you can get it from:
        http://www.fsgames.com/glad/registered/
using the standard password.

Here's a brief description of the features added:

1) Fixed 'friendly-ghost-scare' bug

The ghost in 3.8J was somewhat confused, and would often scare his own
teammates as well as enemies.  This has been fixed.

2) Added patch for overflowing team members (extra characters will now be
randomly scattered over the map)

This is a 'patch' rather than a real fix, but it works for now.  In earlier
versions of the game, if you had "too many" (generally > 20) characters in
your
team, some levels would just make them disappear and not show up on the
level. 
Worse than that was the fact that those characters were then considered dead,
and you'd lose them when you went on to the next level.

For now, the fix we've implemented is that any "excess" teammates will be
scattered randomly around the map.  This certainly isn't ideal, and may create
some weird effects, but it's better than nothing :)

3) Fixed Druid 'reveal' ability

The Druid's "reveal" ability, which is designed to show treasure, potions,
generators, etc., had been accidentally broken in the latest version.  It
works
again.

4) Made exits and teleporters always show up on radar

Exits and teleporters now show up as glowing dots, which should eliminate some
of the searching for a "way out" when you're done with a level :)

5) Added Barbarian's first special: Hurl Boulder, an ability based on strength
6) Added Barbarian's second special: Exploding boulder

More specific information:
1.   Hurl Boulder: All barbarians have the ability to rip large stones from
the
nearby ground and hurl them at enemies.  How far they can throw them, and the
damage the boulders impart, is strongly affected by the strength of the
barbarian.

2.   Exploding Boulder: Using even more energy, a barbarian can hurl a rock
with such strength that it explodes upon impact, damaging any nearby foes.

That's it for now!  Let me (tricket@...) know if you notice any
obvious
errors in this version!

--Tom
